comment: White Labs WLP 830 is supposed to be similar if not the exact same yeast as Wyeast 2124: Weihenstephan 34/70. The packaging made for too much yeast sludge in the bottom of the tube, which did not make it into the starter.
46 hours since yeast was pitched, and still no activity: yikes!
It started fermenting around 24-36 hours; the fermentation lock was not assembled correctly; thus, I thought nothing was happening.

...no, it didn't! This is a long-lag lager thus far; it's been cold, and I way under pitched!
Approaching 100 hours, still no sign of active fermentation.
Starting to show signs of vigor; it's very cold where it's fermenting.
The average primary fermentation temperature was ~46F.
March 17: primary fermentation complete; transferred cloudy, but tasty beer to a 5-gallon carboy, SG: 1.012
Lagered for 234 days, then bottled with 4g. of dry yeast.
